title: Late-night sittings of the Commons leave MPs open to security risks, Labour MP warns
text:
Late-night sittings of the Commons will leave MPs open to security risks, a Labour MP has warned.

Thangam Debbonaire, the Labour MP for Bristol West, raised the security concern as she said debates on key Brexit legislation is expected to run into the early hours of the morning.

Ms Debbonaire criticised the Government's suggested timetable for dealing with the Withdrawal Agreement Bill and raised the point that there would be a lack of taxis for MPs and staff, while public transport will not be operating once the Commons concludes its Wednesday sitting.
